content:
Troubleshooting the Send Message Action in Messaging

In enhanced Messaging channels and Messaging for In-App, you can use the Send Message global action to proactively message a customer in a specific channel. If you have trouble finding the recipient or sending your message, review these troubleshooting tips.

ISSUE	REASON	FIX
You don’t see the Send Message action.	The action wasn’t added to the global action layout.	
On the Publisher Layouts page in Setup, drag the Send Message action to the Mobile and Lightning Actions section of the palette and save your changes.
You don’t have the Initiate Messaging Sessions user permission.	Ask your admin to assign the user permission to you or add it to the Messaging Agent permission set.
You aren’t able to enter a message in the Send Message composer.	(Enhanced WhatsApp only) If more than 24 hours have passed since the selected messaging user’s last message, you can’t send them a freeform message. You can only send Notification messaging components that are linked to an approved WhatsApp template.	In the Send Message composer, click the messaging component action icon. Set the filter to show only Notification messaging components, and select a messaging component to send.
You don’t see the recipient you’re looking for.	The Send Message composer only shows messaging users that meet these criteria: At least one opt-out keyword is set for the channel, and the messaging user hasn’t opted out. Ensure that the criteria are met for the user you’re trying to contact.

(Enhanced WhatsApp only) You’re trying to send a messaging component because the reply period has passed, but the list of components is missing the one you want.	Select a messaging component that meets the criteria.

When selecting a recipient, you see multiple messaging user records with the same name, or multiple records named Guest.	A messaging user record is created for each user who communicates with your business in a specific channel. To send your message to the right messaging user, follow either of these approaches:

Open the messaging user record or an associated account, contact, or lead. Then, click Send Message in the global action menu.
If the messaging user record is linked to an account, contact, or lead, in the Send Message composer, click the icon on the first field and select Account, Contact, or Contact. Select the desired record, and then select a channel. The message is sent to the messaging user associated with the record you selected.

DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Let us know so we can improve!
Yes
No
title: Troubleshooting Send Message Action in Messaging
